page.title: 07LITTLE MARCLE ECOLOGY (1)
page.content: {Conservation } There are some areas of coppice ash, chestnut & hazel. Some hedges & ditches & small patches of woodland are left by farmers for conservation to provide habitats for wild flowers, birds, butterflies, insects & small mammals. At Rushall there is an avenue of ancient gnarled elm tree boles. Sadly Dutch elm disease killed off all the elm trees in the last decade & they had to be felled. A small farm pond near Aylton Court contains carp & other fish which provide sport for local fishermen.
